purpleculture_pinyin:
fù
resembling, like, as if
похоже, как будто
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 弗 indicates the sound; 彳 (step) conveys the meaning.

    • 彳 [ chì ] to step with the left foot
    • 弗 [ fú ] not, negative
heisig_chinese_memo: You line up as though you're going to get some dollars. &nbsp
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the step (彳) towards dollars (弗) (is seen) dimly
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You line up as though you're going to get some dollars. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From "彳" to " Fu " sound. It is often used in conjunction with " imitation " as "as if", and also as "as if" and "as if". It is a two-tone continuous word that expresses like and seems. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. "Nine Debates": "Yan Yinyi will stop, Ke seems to be chlorosis." Nanliang Liu Xie, "Wen Xin Diao Long. "Sorrow": "Five words with a chapter, quite like a ballad, but also like a Han Wu."

"As if" extended to express the general situation, such as Su Shi's "Answer to the Chief Officer of Shangguan" in the Northern Song Dynasty: "During the time, the leaf boat traveled in the wind, rain, cloud, cloudy, sunny, flea and twilight, and the state was ten thousand, and a word of hatred seemed like an ear. "Pu Songling in the Qing Dynasty, "Strange Tales of a Liao Zhai." Book Idiot: "Lang is dying without a word, and his maidservant can speak as if he is a little bit."
humanum_short_description_en: From "彳", " Fu " sound. It is often used in conjunction with " imitation " as "as if" to express as if or as if.
humanum_full_description:
從「彳」，「弗」聲。多與「彷」連用作「彷彿」，又作「仿佛」、「髣髴」，是雙聲連綿詞，表示好像、似乎。如《楚辭．九辯》：「顏淫溢而將罷兮，柯彷彿而萎黃。」南梁劉勰《文心雕龍．哀吊》：「又卒章五言，頗似歌謠，亦彷彿乎漢武也。」

　　「彷彿」引申表示大致的情況，如北宋蘇軾〈答上官長官〉：「時復葉舟縱游其間，風雨雲月，陰晴蚤暮，態狀千萬，恨無一語略寫其彷彿耳。」清代蒲松齡《聊齋志異．書痴》：「郎垂死，無一言，械其婢略能道其彷彿。」
humanum_short_description: 從「彳」，「弗」聲。多與「彷」連用作「彷彿」，表示好像、似乎。

從「 彳 」，「 弗 」聲。多與「 彷 」連用作「彷彿」，又作「仿佛」、「髣髴」，是雙聲連綿詞，表示好像、似乎。如《楚辭．九辯》：「顏淫溢而將罷兮，柯彷彿而萎黃。」南梁劉勰《文心雕龍．哀吊》：「又卒章五言，頗似歌謠，亦彷彿乎漢武也。」 「彷彿」引申表示大致的情況，如北宋蘇軾〈答上官長官〉：「時復葉舟縱游其間，風雨雲月，陰晴蚤暮，態狀千萬，恨無一語略寫其彷彿耳。」清代蒲松齡《聊齋志異．書痴》：「郎垂死，無一言，械其婢略能道其彷彿。」
From " 彳" to " Fu" sound. It is often used in conjunction with " imitation" as "as if", and also as "as if" and "as if". It is a two-tone continuous word that expresses like and seems. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. "Nine Debates": "Yan Yinyi will stop, Ke seems to be chlorosis." Nanliang Liu Xie, "Wen Xin Diao Long. "Sorrow": "Five words with a chapter, quite like a ballad, but also like a Han Wu." "As if" extended to express the general situation, such as Su Shi's "Answer to the Chief Officer of Shangguan" in the Northern Song Dynasty: "During the time, the leaf boat traveled in the wind, rain, cloud, cloudy, sunny, flea and twilight, and the state was ten thousand, and a word of hatred seemed like an ear. "Pu Songling in the Qing Dynasty, "Strange Tales of a Liao Zhai." Book Idiot: "Lang is dying without a word, and his maidservant can speak as if he is a little bit."

彿字的基本解释

彿
fù
同“佛2”①。

彿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fú］
［《廣韻》敷勿切，入物，敷。］
见“彷2彿”。

彿字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【彳字部】　彿； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页365第30
【廣韻】敷勿切，音拂。彷彿也。【說文】本作髴。

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
